values.comments:
*Accounting 411 examines the concepts and procedures for preparing financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. It focuses on the recording process, problems of periodic income measures and valuation, and statement presentation and analysis for companies formed as corporations.

The course had a lot of material to cover in one semester.  Some students acknowledged that it was challenging, but were glad they took it.  One said it was “very helpful and enjoyable.” Another student mentioned that the class covered many “concepts in one semester” and emphasized the need for students to keep up with the course.

Students had mixed reviews about Professor DeProphetis.  Some said she was “kind, a good teacher, and took questions willingly,” while others said “she was unsuitable to teach international students because she lacks the patience and will to make concepts understandable to them.”  One student said not to rely on the professor to explain all of the concepts in the “best or most understandable manner.”  Some felt her teaching style was detrimental because she “limited herself to reading only the information she had on her notes and did not explain the concepts in detail.”

One student said the homework took “about six hours per week.”  Many felt they learned more from the book than anything else because there was no feedback provided from the sessions.  Some students said the “practice exams were nothing like the actual exam” and expressed confusion about what was going to be on the exam.

*This review was based on 8 reviews.
